sect1.title: Installing a Printer
sect1.para: Before you can install a printer, you need to know the root password and have your printer information ready. Depending on how you connect the printer, you might also need the printer URI, TCP/IP address or host, and the driver for the printer. A number of common printer drivers ship with SUSE Linux Enterprise Server. If you cannot find a driver for the printer, check the printer manufacturer's Web site.

step.para: Make sure the CUPS printing service is available and automatically started at boot time:
step.screen: tux > sudo systemctl enable cups.service tux > sudo systemctl start cups.service

step.para: Start the printer configuration by right-clicking the desktop and choosing Settings and then Devices Printers .
Click Unlock in the upper right corner and enter the root password.
If there are too many printers in the list, filter them by entering an IP address or a keyword into the search field in the lower part of the dialog.
Select a printer from the list of available printers and click Add.

sect1.para: The installed printer appears in the Printers panel. You can now print to the printer from any application.
